page.title: 05Farm Produce Upton District.
page.content: {GRASS.}The river meadows on alluvial soil grow excellent grass for cattle raising, hay and silage making, though rather too for sheep except over short periods.{MILK.}Mainly from Friesian cows milked twice daily by machine and collected by bulk tanker, refrigerated and processed at the milk depot. Worcester.Artificial insemination is used to breed dairy cows but a resident Hereford bull is used for selective beef crosses for{MEAT.}All the stock are wintered indoors to maximise food conversion and reduce grass damage.Cattle are sold direct to butcher at 20-24 months.{GRAIN}is harvested by combine dried and stored in sheds till needed,and straw baled for bedding.Fertilizer is mainly liquid cattle slurry from sheds plus some minerals,lime potash and nitrogen.Hedges are cut by machine.
